policy.subject: lhcp
policy.resource: number of submitted physiologic data monitoring report

nlacp: System presents a menu of DLHCP.
The patient or representative chooses one of these DLHCP.
The LHCP, the patient or the representative clicks the "Save" button to save the modified filter.
Upon reading the report, the public health agent can send a "fake email" message to the adverse event reporter to gain more information about the report.

truth.subject: public health agent
truth.purpose: gain more information about the report

policy.subject: public health agent
policy.purpose: gain more information about the report

nlacp: The HCP must cancel the prescription.
An LHCP views his appointments in the current month.
Then, the LHCP can confirm the status setting or consultation entering or cancel.
The LHCP confirms the representative's MID.
A patient, patient representative, or LHCP selects one option out of the "Sort by" labeled drop-down box (with options of "Sender or Recipient" or "Timestamp").
The system shall store reason id number for the reason and the name of the reason.
An LHCP views his message inbox.
A LHCP reviews the consultation.
The administrator stores the CPT code and the name of the immunization.
System presents a list of the patients for which he is allowed to report measurements.
An LHCP views additional information for a patient.
The LHCP is not able to edit any past appointments.
System presents a listing of all his patients to view physiologic data reported during the current date.

truth.subject: system
truth.purpose: view physiologic data reported during the current date

policy.subject: system
policy.purpose: view physiologic data reported during the current date

nlacp: The status of the consultation being sent is set as "pending".
LHCP selects a patient from the list of requested reports.
A patient reports an event related to a prescription drug or immunization reaction.
The message displays the risk factors that the patients exhibit.
A patient's personal representative or a patient or personal representative sends a message to DLHCP or that of a person they are representing.
A patient or personal representative can answer any of the following questions relative to a previous office visit.
Also, the public health agent may  remove an adverse event report (such as based upon communication with the reporter or because the report appears to be bogus).
The administrator shall be allowed to assign a LHCP to multiple hospitals.
System presents a listing of all prescription drugs for which he has been prescribed and has taken in the last 12 months.
The LHCP then selects a referral to view details.
A HCP reviews consultations.
The user can select an appointment from the calendar to read the appointment's details.
A patient views his appointments in the current month together with his office visit dates, prescription dates, and lab procedure dates of the current month on a calendar for the current month.
An LHCP or patient can click the "View Appointment Calendar" link to view his appointments in the current month.

truth.subject: patient
truth.purpose: view his appointments in the current month

truth.subject: lhcp
truth.purpose: view his appointments in the current month

policy.subject: patient
policy.purpose: view his appointments in the current month

policy.subject: lhcp
policy.purpose: view his appointments in the current month

nlacp: The user selects a message from the list to read by clicking the "Read" link beside the row for the message, and then the message subject, the name of the sender, the name of the the recipient, timestamp, and the message text shall be displayed in a new page.
System presents an automatically-calculated value of BMI calculated based on the formula.
A UAP can report physiologic measurements.
The user opens his upcoming appointment list.
An email alert is sent out to the iTrust user in the event of a changed password, status change in laboratory procedure, comprehensive report requested and generated.
When the patient and LHCP are chosen, system presents the MID of the patient that will be sent to the receiving HCP.
He can select a patient and then enter data.
The LHCP enters the patient's MID.

System presents a line chart giving the chosen measurements (either height or weight) of the patient spanning the last 3 calendar years of data, averaged by quarters (January-March, April-June, July-September, October-December).
A fake email is sent to the patient alerting the patient that a new message reply has arrived.
LHCP can delete future appointments.
The patient is then able to write a textual description.
